name: weboptimizer
description: A generic web optimizer, (module) bundler and development environment.

scripts.build: command='babel --extensions '.ts' --plugins @babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties,@babel/plugin-transform-runtime --presets @babel/preset-env,@babel/preset-typescript --source-maps inline --out-file' && $command browser.js browser.ts && $command configurator.js configurator.ts && $command ejsLoader.js ejsLoader.ts && $command helper.js helper.ts && $command index.js index.ts && $command jestEnvironmentBrowser.js jestEnvironmentBrowser.ts && $command stylelintConfigurator.js stylelintConfigurator.ts && $command type.js type.ts && $command webpackConfigurator.js webpackConfigurator.ts && chmod +x index.js
scripts.build:test: yarn clear && yarn build && command='babel --extensions '.ts' --plugins @babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties,@babel/plugin-transform-runtime --presets @babel/preset-env,@babel/preset-typescript --source-maps inline --source-root ../ --out-file' && rimraf node_modules/weboptimizer && mkdir node_modules/weboptimizer && cp *.ts *.js *.json *.ejs node_modules/weboptimizer/ && $command test/browser.js test/browser.ts && $command test/configurator.js test/configurator.ts && $command test/helper.js test/helper.ts && $command test/ejsLoader.js test/ejsLoader.ts && $command test/stylelintConfigurator.js test/stylelintConfigurator.ts && $command test/index.js test/index.ts && $command test/webpackConfigurator.js test/webpackConfigurator.ts
scripts.clear: rimraf apiDocumentation *.js *.compiled.* *.compiled test/*.js test/*.compiled.* *.html *.log node_modules/weboptimizer .nyc_output || true
scripts.test: yarn build:test && jest --test-regex '/test/.+\\.js$' test/browser.js test/configurator.js test/helper.js test/ejsLoader.js test/stylelintConfigurator.js test/index.js test/webpackConfigurator.js

excludeFilePathRegularExpression.#: Only ensure globals for exported modules.

preinstall.#: Create dummy file before building to let build artefacts created on install correctly be set their needed executable bits.

commandLine.#: Configures how to trigger corresponding project livecycle tasks from the command line.

hot.#: Indicates whether to activate the developments hot module replacement feature.

javaScript.#: We have to ensure, that the highest resolvable dependency inside this project will be used in node environments to ensure one instance of each dependent artefact for linked projects. We have to wrap "require" into an eval call to avoid other pre-processing scripts to replace this statement here.

autoExclude: #: NOTE: We have to add "test.js" here additionally to be able to grab "test.compiled.js" and "test.js" at the same time.

exclude: #: Usually we need to pre-process these artefacts against target technology specific environment.

inPlace.#: Indicates whether to include the corresponding artefacts into build target artefact or reference them to dynamically include them during runtime.

options.#: Configure to resolve artefacts referenced by image or link tags (minimize configuration object has to be "false" in case it resolves to "null").

topLevel.#: Indicates to not mangle scope names from the entry (main) scope in libraries.

cssnano.#: The autoprefixer has to be disabled in this context since it would remove all needed vendor prefixes from the preceding processing (every prefix should be needed here).

htmlMinifier.#: NOTE: Needed for attribute nested quotes which should be escaped.

disable.__evaluate__: self.debug || 2 < self.givenCommandLineArguments.length && self.givenCommandLineArguments[2] !== 'build' ? true : self.debug && console.warn(`Image compression disabled. Use configuration: "{module:{optimizer:{image:{content:{disable:false}}}}}" to enable it.`) || true

minimizer.#: HTML-Templates shouldn't be transformed via terser to avoid html webpack plugin throwing to not get markup as intermediate result.

presets.#: NOTE: We have to disable module export/import transforming to allow tree shaking by the final (minimizer).
presets.__evaluate__: [['@babel/preset-env', {loose: true, modules: false, targets: self.targetTechnology === 'node' ? {node: 'current'} : {browsers: self.generic.supportedBrowsers, node: 'current'}}], '@babel/typescript'].concat((self.debug || !self.module.optimizer.babelMinify.module || 2 < self.givenCommandLineArguments.length && self.givenCommandLineArguments[2] === 'document') ? [] : [['minify', self.module.optimizer.babelMinify.module]])

provide.#: Defines resources which should be mapped to given variables without referencing them explicitly.

replacements.#: Defines referenced resources or contexts to be replaced.

style.#: Includes referenced (hot module replaced) css files in-place into the html header to dynamically migrate them on changes without browser refresh.

nodeEnvironment.#: Indicates which node environment variables should be included in built artefacts.

pattern.#: This is how we can make our test artefact executable.

autoExclude: #: NOTE: We have to add "test.js" here additionally to be able to grab "test.compiled.js" and "test.js" at the same time.
